src:
Sempat Hilang, Wanita Ini Ditemukan Berlayar di Laut Aegea
06 Nov 2019, 01:38 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Otoritas Yunani telah menyelamatkan seorang wanita berusia 47 tahun yang mengambang di perahu karet di Laut Aegea. Dia ditemukan setelah dua hari dilaporkan menghilang.
Wanita itu mengaku sedang berlibur dengan perahu layar di dekat pulau Yunani Folegandros, naik perahu karet pada 1 November lalu. Sehari kemudian, otoritas Yunani mendapat laporan bahwa wanita itu hilang.
Akhirnya wanita itu ditemukan pada Minggu (5/11) pagi sekitar 40 mil laut di barat daya Folegandros yang berdekatan dengan pulau Kreta. Tujuh kapal penjaga pantai, tiga kapal pribadi, pesawat, dan helikopter terlibat dalam operasi pencarian wanita itu.
"Saya terpesona, terpesona oleh perahu saya," kata wanita itu seperti dilansir Reuters, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Usai ditemukan oleh petugas keamanan, dia langsung mendapatkan perawatan medis. Wanita yang enggan memberi tahu namanya itu mengaku hanya mengandalkan permen selama dua hari terjebak di lautan.
Seorang pejabat penjaga pantai mengatakan kepada Reuters dan media lokal melaporkan bahwa dia adalah pelaut berpengalaman dari Selandia Baru.

(zap/zap)
text:
Once lost, this woman was found sailing in the Aegean Sea
Nov 6, 2019, 01:38 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Greek authorities have rescued a 47-year-old woman floating on a rubber boat in the Aegean Sea. He was found after two days reported missing.
The woman claimed to be on vacation with a sailboat near the Greek island of Folegandros, riding a rubber boat on November 1 last. A day later, Greek authorities received a report that the woman was missing.
Finally the woman was found on Sunday (11/5) morning about 40 nautical miles southwest of Folegandros, which is close to the island of Crete. Seven coast guard ships, three private ships, planes and helicopters were involved in the search for the woman.
"I was fascinated, fascinated by my boat," said the woman as reported by Reuters on Wednesday (11/06/2019).
After being discovered by security officers, he immediately received medical treatment. The woman who was reluctant to tell her name said she only relied on candy for two days trapped in the ocean.
A coast guard official told Reuters and local media reported that he was an experienced sailor from New Zealand.

(zap / zap)
